Title: China donates flood relief materials to Nigeria
Summary: The Red Cross Society of China has donated 1,000 family kits to the Nigerian Red Cross . The handover ceremony was held at the Nigerian . Red Cross society of China, through its Embassy, has donated .

Title: Katsina probes councillors, CDOs over financial mismanagement
Summary: Katsina State Public Complaints and Anti-Corruption Commission says it is investigating 15 councillors over alleged extortion and financial mismanagement . The Commission’s Secretary, Mr Jamilu Abdulsalam, disclosed this in a statement issued on Friday in Katsina .

Title: Nigeria’s future rests on your shoulders, COAS tasks NDA graduands
Summary: Nigeria’s future rests on your shoulders, COAS tells NDA graduands . Lt.-Gen. Olufemi Oluyede charged them to be prepared for it . He stated this at a Regimental Dinner held in Nigeria .

Title: Following Christ’s footsteps – Part 5
Summary: Following the footprints of Christ is following the examples of Christ in His Word . In Matthew 4:18-22, Jesus saw two brothers, Simon Peter and Andrew who were both fishermen and He called them to follow Him,..

Title: Over 100 Nigerians held in India drug cases
Summary: More than 100 Nigerians were among foreign nationals arrested for drug trafficking in India last year . Figures released by the country’s narcotics control agency . Raises questions about international drug networks and Nigeria's global reputation .

Title: When Maggi owns the tongue and government owns the people, by Stephanie Shaakaa
Summary: We don't just use products, we baptize them with the name of the strongest brand in the room, says Shaakaa . The government owns the tongue and the people, she says .

Title: Nigeria: The weight of a name, from the +234 streets to the world, by Stephanie Shaakaa
Summary: Nigeria: The weight of a name, from the +234 streets to the world, by Stephanie Shaakaa . Sometimes the heaviest inheritance a Nigerian carries is a single word . It is stamped on the passport. Printed on the CV. Whispered at checkpoints .

Title: Hypocrites in love, by Stepahnie Shaakaa
Summary: Stepahnie Shaakaa says refusal to kneel is not just about posture, it is about pride . Pride starts small, in gestures, she says .

Title: Fubara resumes, reaffirms loyalty to Tinubu, Wike
Summary: Siminalayi Fubara pledges loyalty to his predecessor, Nyesom Wike, and President Tinubu . He resisted the temptation to challenge the constitutionality of the declaration of emergency rule in Rivers on March 18 due to his commitment to peace .

Title: Drug promotions flooding social media: How patients go blind, suffer stroke, experience kidney failure
Summary: Drug promotions flooding social media: How patients go blind, suffer stroke, experience kidney failure . "... These medicines sold online are contributing to a surge in preventable complications such as kidney and liver failure, sudden blindness, strokes, and even deaths"
